question: Looking at this choropleth map, which statement below is the most accurate?

options.A: States F and G have quite different values.
options.B: The value difference between State A and State D is large.
options.C: The value gap between State H and State I might exceed that between State F and State G.
options.D: The value differences are impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: States F(40) and G(45) have a 5-point difference, while States H(55) and I(65) have a 10-point difference. However, the categorical color encoding groups F and G into different color bins (F in 30-45, G in 45+), making their small difference appear large, while H and I appear similar due to being in the same color bin (45+).
